alert.note: Alert for Bath; Fleming; Montgomery; Rowan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 3:05PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Montgomery, central Bath, south central Fleming and west central Rowan Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 304 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Camargo, or 7 miles southeast of Mount Sterling, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Walkers Crossing, Hope, Howards Mill and Clay Lick around 310 PM EDT. Peeled Oak and Stepstone around 315 PM EDT. Preston, Crooks, Bourbon Furnace and Kendall Springs around 320 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Owingsville, Olympia, Olympia Springs, Craigs, Marshall, Salt Lick, Polksville, Peasticks, Slate Valley, Young Springs, Odessa, Moore`s Ferry, Midland, Farmers, Wyoming, Oakley, Ramey, Freestone, Bluestone, Grange City, Hillsboro, Morehead, Sharkey, Ringos Mills and Brandy. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 114 and 137. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
